Topic.Title: Did Yahoo move its earnings date back 5 days because it wanted numbers from Alibaba?

Message.Msg: I don't recall it being anything less than the 28th, going back to late November/December, as I've been checking it for awhile now. That being said, it really doesn't matter, as Alibaba's revenue numbers have never been included in the quarterly earnings. They shove it in the annual report but it has zero impact on Yahoo's earnings. Earnings themselves I'm guessing are going to be boring as Yahoo is quite predictable...220M+ operating income in Q4, revenue of 1.2-1.3B maybe(flat), less than 5% growth, negative in some sectors and probably bought back $500M-$1B worth of shares judging by the pop in share price. Its possible they spent $1.5B+ which would remove 100M shares, giving the stock an inflated 10% pop. Oh and I expect Yahoo's cash to fall billions either in this quarters earnings or next quarter to cover the Alibaba taxes and stock buyback. On a side note, what is the breakdown to get your "additional $100M" figure? I figure its easier to ask then go digging for Alibaba's revenues times Yahoo's stake. thanks!

Topic.Title: Yahoo Anxious to End Microsoft Search Deal

Message.Msg: Marissa Mayer is a really smart lady who actually was the key person of the successful of Google(she designed the clean and beautiful home page of Google which directly led Google to success). She knows that MSFT is trying stealing search market from Yahoo instead of Google with its search deal. Facebook would need the search technology and patent from Yahoo to fight with Google. MSFT is out and dying due to its greedy. Apple wants to build its own search engine, however, it might takes years to archive it. Before it could do it, Android had already killed IPhone and iPad. So Apple needs search too and needs search immediately to fight Google. Both Facebook and Apple has the ambition to fight Google since Google is trying to kill both of them.

Message.Title: Marissa Mayer's Plan To Save Yahoo Suddenly Looks Much Different Than Anyone Predicted
Message.Msg: First there was Yahoo's recently completed deal with CBS to bring new content into its gossip site, OMG. Next, there were the remarks Mayer's recently-hired number two and fellow ex-Googler, COO Henrique De Castro, gave over at a conference in Germany. He said that âthe desktop portal needs to transform itself" and that the best ones going forward would "aggregate premium quality content at scale, and distribute it in a personalized way.â And now there's a report from All Things D's Kara Swisher about a secret project Mayer has Yahoo working on called "Project Zed." Multiple sources tell Swisher the plan is to make Yahoo a "destination where people go to find content regardless of where it originates from; the better Yahoo gets at making it more relevant, the more it becomes part of peopleâs everyday routine and the more repeat visitors there are.â Another says it will be a âtrusted destination to get them to where they want to go and keep going back.â When Mayer was hired, people thought that meant Yahoo was going to be a "products" company. It's not. It's not a "media" company either. With Mayer running the show, and some of Levinsohn's ideas moving forward, it's becoming what it always should have been â a media + products company.

Topic.Title: Marissa Mayer's Plan To Save Yahoo Suddenly Looks Much Different Than Anyone Predicted

Message.Msg: I hope and I think this article hits on it...but as a shareholder I want to see YHOO bring on all kinds of apps. Yahoo has a hige online presence and every company in the world needs more users...

Message.Title: Yahoo to Acquire Content Curation Site Snip.it
Message.Msg: Yahoo is expected to announce this week that it has acquired Snip.it, a Pinterest-like site for article curation, according to sources familiar with the deal. Snip.it was founded by Ramy Adeeb, who was formerly a principal at Khosla Ventures, and has funding from Khosla, True Ventures, Charles River Ventures and SV Angel. Yahoo is paying âmid teensâ of millions of dollars for the company, according to a source.

Message.Title: Mayer really screwed those who are long YHOO and have been supporters of....
Message.Msg: ...the company in favor of the YHOO haters. Look at how poorly YHOO has performed in this past week plus of very strong market compared to FB, GOOG, NOK, RIMM etc. And on very low volume which shows that YHOO is NOT buying backs shares which must be because they do not believe the shares are cheap. Why would she not buy back shares with YHOO so low and with all that cash (doing nothing but a 1% or so return for so long) and a buy back authorized. With all the Jan. options she could have put it to the shorts and easily run the shares up well above $20 but instead she screwed the longs. Marissa, why do you not want YHOO's price higher???

Message.Title: Seriously MM, if you and YHOO do not want to buy YHOO shares (just free options and food! for you) why should....
Message.Msg: ....anyone else buy YHOO? YHOO should have been at least $22 going into earnings and yet again it shows it can not hold even $20 in a strong market. Now with good earnings it may get to $21, but a dissapointment could easily send it to $18 or less. What was the point of selling out the 20% of AG for so cheap if not to greatly reduce share count and finally reward long suffering shareholders? Rather then collect 1% interest or so on the money YHOO should have even borrowed at these low rates and bought back enough shares to get well below one bil. outstanding by now. They should have at least done a div. but not even that. You suck MM!

Message.Title: When I say YHOO sold AG stake for so cheap (yet has not even used the cash except for free I-phones and gourmet food) I mean....
Message.Msg: ...YHOO sold AG just last May as if AG was worth only $34 bil. in total when it is now trading at an equiv. of a bit over $50 bil, (with an IPO expected to be perhaps much higher). So YHOO left a LOT on the table to Ma's -a sleaze who has screwed YHOO before-benefit. Notice that Softbank did NOT sell any stake back to Ma!! Now YHOO's move would be ok (just to break the impass w/ Ma) IF they had used that money to greatly reduce YHOO share count, (dutch auction?) and/or do a big dividend. They did not even need the cash but all YHOO has done is collect very small interest on all that money. So Kara S. can write articles that send YHOO down by billions in a day and Mayer does not have the sense to support the price with the cash and announced buyback but instead lets YHOO holders get screwed, and YHOO shorts win, and Kara make her look the fool (angain at the expense of YHOO holders). But MM does not take Kara's phone calls so she is really showing her, as YHOO owners lose once again. Thanks a lot MM!!!

Topic.Title: .28 cents consensus?

Message.Msg: They have NEVER INCLUDED AG yet in quarterly earnings! They won't sniff .55 when they're only projected for $1.10+ for the YEAR. You do know that not a single event has an impact on Yahoo right? Every year its something whether its Michael Jacksons death, Patrick Swayze, both Olympics, 2 presidential elections...NONE have an impact. Yahoo's revenues are simply too broad, too International, and simply too large to be impacted. Google was very light on revenue tonight and revenue per-click is falling so the question becomes did Yahoo buy enough shares to offset that? Yahoo's operating income for the previous year was $840M and you aren't to far for the QUARTER! I don't get it...you make the same topic yesterday, I correct you, and you STILL believe what is WRONG. Head over to Investor Relations if you don't believe me as the last 4 quarters are there...99.9999% sure you won't find AG revenue in any of it.
